entry.title: The New Opportunities Fund (Specification of Initiatives) (No.2) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order specifies initiatives concerned or connected with health, education or the environment and accordingly allows the New Opportunities Fund to make grants, or make or enter into arrangements, under section 43B of the National Lottery etc. Act 1993 which are designed to give effect to those initiatives.

entry.title: The Navy and Marines (Property of Deceased) (Amendment) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order amends the Navy and Marines (Property of Deceased) Order 1956. The 1956 Order deals with the situation where an officer, seaman or marine is entitled to a medal that has not been issued to him at the date of his death, and he has not left the medal by the terms of a will. It provides for a list of relations, in priority order, to whom the medal is to be given. This Order amends the reference to widow in the 1956 Order to include a widower or surviving civil partner.

entry.title: The Misuse of Drugs Act 1971 (Amendment) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order inserts Ketamine into Part 3 of Schedule 2 to the Misuse of Drugs Act 1971, which specifies drugs which are subject to control under that Act as Class C drugs.

entry.title: The Ulster Defence Regiment (Amendment) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order amends the Order by Her Majesty dated 4th January 1971 (“the principal Order”) in consequence of the introduction of civil partnerships by the Civil Partnership Act 2004 (2004 c. 33).

entry.title: The Consular Fees (Amendment) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order amends the Consular Fees Order 2005.

entry.title: The Naval Medical Compassionate Fund (Amendment) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order amends the Standing Orders and Regulations of the Naval Medical Compassionate Fund in consequence of the introduction of civil partnerships by the Civil Partnership Act 2004 (2004 c 33).

entry.title: The Reporting of Suspicious Civil Partnerships Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations set out the procedure for reporting certain civil partnerships to the Secretary of State where it is suspected that the civil partnership will be, or is, a sham civil partnership.

entry.title: The Sports Grounds and Sporting Events (Designation) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order designates any sports ground and classes of sporting events taking place at those grounds or outside England and Wales for the purposes of the Sporting Events (Control of Alcohol etc.) Act 1985. The Act does not, by virtue of section 9(6), apply to any sporting event in which all competitors are to take part otherwise than for reward and to which all spectators are to be admitted free of charge. This Order comes into force on 14th December 2005.

entry.title: The Service Departments Registers (Amendment) Order 2005

ukm:Subject.Value: REGISTRATION OF BIRTHS, DEATHS, MARRIAGES, ETC.

category.term: REGISTRATION OF BIRTHS, DEATHS, MARRIAGES, ETC.

entry.summary: The Registration of Births, Deaths and Marriages (Special Provisions) Act 1957 (“the 1957 Act”) empowers Her Majesty to provide by Order in Council for the keeping of records of births, deaths and marriages relating to HM armed forces and associated civilians. The Services Departments Registers Order 1959 (“the 1959 Order”) sets out the relevant provisions. Schedule 27 of the Civil Partnership Act 2004 amended the 1957 Act to extend the keeping of records to civil partnerships. This Order further amends the 1959 Order to make the necessary provision for the keeping of records of civil partnerships.

entry.title: The Disability Discrimination (Transport Vehicles) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations provide for certain provisions in Part 3 of the Disability Discrimination Act 1995 (“the Act”) to apply to the providers of certain transport services.

entry.title: The West Suffolk Hospitals National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Trust Property) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order transfers to the Suffolk Mental Health Partnership National Health Service Trust, trust property held by the West Suffolk Hospitals National Health Service Trust and makes related provision. A copy of the schedule of trust property transferred under this Order can be obtained from the Department of Health, Room 3W58, Quarry House, Quarry Hill, Leeds LS2 7UE.

entry.title: The Local Government Pension Scheme (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Local Government Pension Scheme Regulations 1997.

entry.title: The Civil Partnership (Armed Forces) Order 2005
entry.summary: Section 211 of the Civil Partnership Act 2004 (“the Act”) empowers Her Majesty, by Order in Council, to make provision for two people to register as civil partners of each other in prescribed countries or territories outside the United Kingdom where one of the proposed civil partners is a member of Her Majesty’s armed forces serving in the country or territory or is a person employed in such country or territory in a prescribed capacity or is a child of either of the foregoing having his home in the country or territory with his parent. Part 2 of the Order sets out the provisions required in order to allow civil partnership registration under section 211. Section 239 of the Act applies to cases where two people wish to register as civil partners of each other in England and Wales but one of them (“A”) is not resident in England and Wales at the time and is an officer, seaman or marine borne on the books of one of Her Majesty’s ships at sea. Section 239 empowers Her Majesty, by Order in Council, to make provision to permit the ship’s captain or other officer in command of the ship to issue A with a certificate of no impediment which will enable the registration authority in England and Wales to apply the modified procedure for certain non-residents. Part 3 of the Order sets out the provisions required by section 239.

entry.title: The Overseas Territories (Zimbabwe) (Restrictive Measures) (Amendment) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order amends the Overseas Territories (Zimbabwe) (Restrictive Measures) Order 2002 (S.I. 2002/1077) to replace the list of persons in Schedule 4 to the Order with a reference to the list set out in the Annex (as modified from time to time) to Council Common Position 2004/161/CFSP (OJ L 50, 20.2.2004, p.66). The list was last modified by Council Decision 2005/592/CFSP of 29 July 2005 (OJ L 200, 30.7.2005, p.98). As a result of the new definition of “listed person” future modifications to the list by the Council of the European Union will take effect immediately without requiring amendment of the Order.

entry.title: The Criminal Justice (International Co operation) Act 1990 (Enforcement of Overseas Forfeiture Orders) (Scotland) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order makes provision in respect of the enforcement in Scotland of orders made in designated countries for the forfeiture of anything in respect of which an offence has been committed or which was used in connection with the commission of an offence. The designated countries are listed in Schedule 2.

entry.title: The Naval, Military and Air Forces Etc. (Disablement and Death) Service Pensions (Amendment) (No. 3) Order 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Service Pensions Order 1983 (“the principal Order”).

entry.title: The Civil Partnership (Registration Provisions) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations provide English and Welsh forms for the registration of civil partnerships in England and Wales.

entry.title: The Criminal Justice (International Co-operation) Act 1990 (Enforcement of Overseas Forfeiture Orders) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order makes provision in respect of the enforcement in England and Wales of orders made in designated countries for the forfeiture of anything in respect of which an offence has been committed or which was used in connection with the commission of such an offence.

entry.title: The Criminal Justice (International Co-operation) Act 1990 (Enforcement of Overseas Forfeiture Orders) (Northern Ireland) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order makes provision in respect of the enforcement in Northern Ireland of orders made in designated countries for the forfeiture of anything in respect of which an offence has been committed or which was used in connection with the commission of such an offence.

entry.title: The Clergy Discipline Appeal Rules 2005
entry.summary: These rules are made pursuant to section 45 of the Clergy Discipline Measure 2003 for the purposes of carrying into effect the provisions of the Measure in relation to appeals under section 20.
